file_content.text: I need more droids--not excuses!
Perhaps you should have left me some isotope-5. What am I supposed to build your war machines with, durachrome and phobium?
I am an artist, Toborro--but I require the proper time and materials to produce my masterpieces. Respect my process!
Liar! The Republic and Empire have united against me, and now you've joined the enemy. I see who stands in your lab!
The chrono's running. You will not escape justice--or this Jedi. Give us what we want, and we'll be merciful.
We're closing in on you.
Do you never tire of your own voice?
We're fighting over a dying planet. This madness must end. Let the Jedi help you negotiate peace and end this pointless conflict.
We come in peace.
If you are trying to put me to sleep... it is working!
Havoc Squad's coming for you next. Be a good host and prepare snacks.
Don't feel left out.
Your name may intimidate the Empire, but in Huttese, that word translates as "clumsy half-wit who dies embarrassingly."
Don't mind me, I'm just enjoying the show. I never knew how big Hutts' nostrils could flare when they get upset with each other.
You're cute when you bicker.
Do not mock me! I'll grind that pretty face of yours into the dirt!
The Republic hasn't made friends with the Empire--and the doctor doesn't work for us. Not yet, anyway.
Wrong, Toborro.
You lie! You're all liars! But I see the truth!
Anyone who isn't with us is on the losing team. I'm sure Doctor Oggurobb is smart enough to see that.
The doctor works for us, now.
I knew it! I will use your liquefied brains to grease my droids, doctor!
Listen to reason. Think! It is not too late to cut a deal with the Republic.
There will be no deal! If you are not with me, you are dead!
Churlish nincompoop! You can see why I was forced to lend my brilliance to your assault. I'm glad you're here.
You know why we're here. Millions of innocent people will die if we don't get the fuel for Toborro's ark.
We need the isotope-5.
Then you have come to the wrong place. Toborro took every microgram of it--including the ark's fuel rods that I constructed.
You helped us defeat your own security grid. I thought your people only spoke in Huttese.
You're our mysterious friend.
All Hutts can speak your language--we simply choose not to. Given the circumstances, I prefer to avoid linguistic misunderstandings.
Unless you want your beautiful mind splattered all over this lab, you'd better cooperate.
Don't cross us. We're violent.
Please don't waste your time on grisly threats. I submit to your superior position.
We have complementary goals. You want what Toborro possesses, and I wish very much not to die here.
Provide me with transport off this doomed planet. I will aid your efforts to recover the isotope-5 fuel rods that power Toborro's ark.
Tell us where the fuel rods are, and we'll consider your offer.
Share what you know now.
What you seek lies within Toborro's private fortress. That part is elementary. Accessing it will require abundant artistry.
You're the only halfway-decent Hutt we've met in a while. I suppose that should count for something.
You have a deal.
How fortunate for me, that my brethren have profoundly lowered your expectations.
I'm taking everything in your databanks--and anything that isn't nailed down.
I'm looting this place, first.
I was going to suggest the same thing. Pity to let all this go to waste when the planet implodes.
I have a personal shuttle here. It's large enough to accommodate us all. Thanks to you, it can now fly.
We should leave before Toborro sends an army to kill us. Take me to your allies, and I will explain what must be done.
Shall we depart? I'd rather not be here when Toborro sends reinforcements.
My apologies for the earlier subterfuge--a necessary contrivance. Toborro seized control of my defenses and was watching me closely. But I am no one's prisoner!
I keep a shuttle nearby that seats six--a tight squeeze, but I'll just fit. I assume you brought your own transportation.
